Use this dataset to answer questions such as: What disbursements has an ETC received from USAC? What type of High Cost support does each state receive?

USAC is committed to sharing the highest quality data possible. We conduct a full analysis of all datasets to determine if they are complete prior to publishing. Each dataset field is described with a “field completeness” metric that ranges from 0 to 100 percent. Any value less than 100 percent indicates a field with missing values.

resource.name: Lifeline Companies Near Me
resource.description: This dataset provides the information of all the carriers providing Lifeline and Affordable Connectivity Program (ACP) service, their customer service number, service type, state, and URL. The purpose of this dataset is to provide the most accurate list of carriers providing service in a particular area within a given state, through the use of zip codes. To ensure that this data is up-to-date and accurate, it is refreshed periodically to add new carriers and the corresponding zip codes of their designated service areas, update the zip codes for existing carriers, and remove zip codes for carriers that have relinquished their ETC designation. In the event that a user enters a zip code that does not return any service provider(s), a complete listing of the state in which the zip code is found will be returned with the recommendation that the consumer confirm the availability of Lifeline or ACP service in their chosen zip code with a service provider from that state.
columns_description: Eligible households can also receive a one-time discount of up to $100 to purchase a laptop, desktop computer, or tablet from participating providers if they contribute more than $10 and less than $50 toward the purchase price.
A provider offers one or more plans that are covered in full by the ACP discount and by choosing one of those plans your monthly cost for service is $0.

Full legal name of the carrier.
County of the area where the carrier provides service.
Customer service phone number of the carrier.
Zip code of the area where the carrier provides service.

Type of service provided by the carrier. It may be wireless or wireline for service offered through the Lifeline Program. It may be ACP Home Internet or ACP Mobile Internet for service offered through the ACP.

domain_metadata.value: This dataset provides the information of all the carriers providing Lifeline service, their customer service number, service type, state, and URL for a particular zip code. The purpose of this dataset is to provide the most accurate list of carriers providing service in a particular area within a given state, through the use of zip codes. To ensure that this data is up-to-date and accurate, it is refreshed periodically to add new carriers and the corresponding zip codes of their designated service areas, update the zip codes for existing carriers, and remove zip codes for carriers that have relinquished their ETC designation. In the event that a user enters a zip code that does not return any service provider(s), a complete listing of the state in which the zip code is found will be returned with the recommendation that the consumer confirm the availability of Lifeline in their chosen zip code with a service provider from that state.

USAC is committed to sharing the highest quality data possible. We conduct a full analysis of all datasets to determine if they are complete prior to publishing. Each dataset is then noted with a “field completeness” metric that ranges from 0% to 100%. Any metric less than 100% means that users left certain fields blank when reporting the information to USAC.

resource.name: Rural Health Care Commitments and Disbursements (FCC Form 462/466/466A)
resource.description: This dataset contains data about funding decisions, total committed amounts, and total disbursement amounts for the Rural Health Care (RHC) Program. The data is collected from the FCC Form 462 (Funding Request Form, Health Care Connect Fund (HCF)), FCC Form 466 (Funding Request and Certification Form, Telecommunications program) and FCC Form 466A (Internet Service Funding Request and Certification Form, Telecommunications program). All information within the FCC Forms 462, 466, and 466A data collection is self-reported by applicants.
columns_description: Indicates the last day to submit invoice(s) to USAC.

Upload speed requested by an HCF Program applicant. If “NA,” then relates to service where bandwidth is not applicable, e.g., network equipment.
Bandwidth speed requested by applicant.  Bandwidth field will be used for all Telecom applicants, and for HCF applicant only if the bandwidth (upload/download) requested is symmetrical.

RHC is comprised of two programs: Health Care Connect Fund (HCF) and Telecommunications program. This field specifies which program the applicant applied for.

FRN line number can be used to filter the records associated with a specific FRN, i.e., the FRN Line Number helps to identify a particular record when there are multiple record entries associated with the same FRN, which can occur with HCF Program requests. If field states “unallocated,” then support is not yet allocated to a specific site.

All information within the Basic Information (FCC Form 471) dataset is self-reported by applicants.

USAC is committed to sharing the highest quality data possible. We conduct a full analysis of all datasets to determine if they are complete prior to publishing. Each dataset field is described with a “field completeness” metric that ranges from 0 -100%. Any value less than 100% indicates a field with missing values. In most cases, missing values are the result of “not required” fields.

domain_metadata.value: This dataset contains E-Rate Productivity Center (EPC) information about schools, libraries, school districts, library systems, consortia, and non-instructional facilities (NIFs). For data about annexes, please reference the data set titled “E-Rate Annex Information”.  The data set is updated nightly and includes the latest updates to EPC entity profiles as of 9 p.m. ET from the previous day. Parent and child relationships are included in the data set for each entity. If a given entity has more than one parent (e.g., an entity that is a member of two consortia) the entity will be listed multiple times. The data set includes a field for entity status which indicates whether the entity is active or closed.

USAC is committed to sharing the highest quality data possible. We conduct a full analysis of all datasets to determine if they are complete prior to publishing. Each dataset is then noted with a “field completeness” metric that ranges from 0% - 100%. Any metric less than 100% means that applicants left certain fields blank when reporting the information to USAC.

resource.name: High Cost: Connect America Fund Broadband Map (CAF Map)
resource.description:
This dataset serves as the foundation for the Connect America Fund Broadband Map (CAF Map), an interactive online map that shows the impact of the Connect America Fund (CAF) on broadband expansion to close the digital divide in rural America. The CAF Map displays the geographic areas that are eligible for CAF support, as well as the specific fixed locations where carriers participating in the program have built out mass-market, high-speed Internet service. The dataset includes address, latitude and longitude coordinates, carrier name, deployment year and minimum speeds offered for every location where CAF-supported service is available. 

The information in this dataset comes directly from carriers, which submit broadband deployment data annually through USAC’s High Cost Universal Broadband (HUBB) portal showing where they have built out service using CAF funding. The current CAF Map is based on data certified in the HUBB as of March 10, 2023, to reflect broadband deployment through Dec. 31, 2022. USAC independently verifies deployment to a random sample of locations reported in the HUBB each year to monitor carrier compliance with CAF build-out obligations.

resource.name: Rural Health Care Posted Services (FCC Form 461/465)
resource.description:
This dataset contains data allowing service providers to view service request information provided by individual Health Care Providers (HCPs) and consortia applying for funding through the Rural Health Care (RHC) Program. resource.name: Lifeline Companies Near Me
resource.description: This dataset provides the information of all the carriers providing Lifeline and Affordable Connectivity Program (ACP) service, their customer service number, service type, state, and URL. The purpose of this dataset is to provide the most accurate list of carriers providing service in a particular area within a given state, through the use of zip codes. To ensure that this data is up-to-date and accurate, it is refreshed periodically to add new carriers and the corresponding zip codes of their designated service areas, update the zip codes for existing carriers, and remove zip codes for carriers that have relinquished their ETC designation. In the event that a user enters a zip code that does not return any service provider(s), a complete listing of the state in which the zip code is found will be returned with the recommendation that the consumer confirm the availability of Lifeline or ACP service in their chosen zip code with a service provider from that state.

The purpose of this dataset is to provide the most accurate list of carriers providing service in a particular area within a given state, through the use of zip codes. To ensure that this data is up-to-date and accurate, it is refreshed periodically to add new carriers and the corresponding zip codes of their designated service areas, update the zip codes for existing carriers, and remove zip codes for carriers that have relinquished their ETC designation. In the event that a user enters a zip code that does not return any service provider(s), a complete listing of the state in which the zip code is found will be returned with the recommendation that the consumer confirm the availability of Lifeline in their chosen zip code with a service provider from that state.

USAC is committed to sharing the highest quality data possible. We conduct a full analysis of all datasets to determine if they are complete prior to publishing. Each dataset is then noted with a “field completeness” metric that ranges from 0% to 100%. Any metric less than 100% means that users left certain fields blank when reporting the information to USAC.

resource.name: High Cost: Connect America Fund Broadband Map (CAF Map)
resource.description:
This dataset serves as the foundation for the Connect America Fund Broadband Map (CAF Map), an interactive online map that shows the impact of the Connect America Fund (CAF) on broadband expansion to close the digital divide in rural America. The CAF Map displays the geographic areas that are eligible for CAF support, as well as the specific fixed locations where carriers participating in the program have built out mass-market, high-speed Internet service. The dataset includes address, latitude and longitude coordinates, carrier name, deployment year and minimum speeds offered for every location where CAF-supported service is available. 

The information in this dataset comes directly from carriers, which submit broadband deployment data annually through USAC’s High Cost Universal Broadband (HUBB) portal showing where they have built out service using CAF funding. The current CAF Map is based on data certified in the HUBB as of March 10, 2023, to reflect broadband deployment through Dec. 31, 2022. USAC independently verifies deployment to a random sample of locations reported in the HUBB each year to monitor carrier compliance with CAF build-out obligations.

domain_metadata.value: This dataset serves as the foundation for the Connect America Fund Broadband Map (CAF Map), which displays the geographic areas eligible for CAF support, as well as the specific fixed locations where carriers participating in the program have built out broadband service. The information in the CAF Map comes directly from carriers, which submit broadband deployment data annually through USAC’s High Cost Universal Broadband (HUBB) portal. The current CAF Map is based on data certified in the HUBB as of March 10, 2023, to reflect broadband deployment through Dec. 31, 2022. USAC independently verifies deployment to a random sample of reported locations each year to monitor carrier compliance with CAF build-out obligations, but not all data in the map has been subject to this review.

USAC is committed to sharing the highest quality data possible. We conduct a full analysis of all datasets to determine if they are complete prior to publishing. resource.name: Lifeline Disbursements
resource.description: This dataset provides information on total support dollars disbursed and total subscribers claimed by Eligible Telecommunication Carriers (ETCs) within the Lifeline Program by month and year since January 2018. This dataset displays an ETC’s Study Area Code (SAC) but does not include the Service Provider Identification Number (SPIN). If a search needs to be performed by SPIN, please refer to the legacy Funding Disbursement Search Tool, which includes all total support dollars disbursed and total subscribers claimed from 2004 to the present. If searching by "SPIN Name," please refer to the FCC Filings and use the most recent appendix to find the proper name.
columns_description: Indicates whether the funds were disbursed from the Lifeline, Linkup or Toll Limitation Services (TLS) program.
Month of the "Data Month" field on FCC Form 497 or the Lifeline Claims System.

Year and month of disbursement to carrier in MM/DD/YYYY format.

Standard name used to identify a study area. Typically, the study area name is the same as the carrier name.
The "Data Month" field on FCC Form 497 or the Lifeline Claims System.
Number of subscribers being claimed.
Indicates whether the service was voice, broadband, or bundled.
Year of disbursement to carrier.
Unique six-digit number assigned to each Eligible Telecommunications Carrier (ETC) based on its service area
State abbreviation for carrier receiving Lifeline support.
Amount of funding disbursed to carrier.
Indicates whether the carrier’s technology is wireline or wireless.
Indicates whether the support type was given to a tribal or non-tribal area.
Indicates whether the carrier is an incumbent local exchange carrier (ILEC) or a competitive eligible telecommunications carrier (CETC).
Year of the "Data Month" field on FCC Form 497 or the Lifeline Claims System.

domain_metadata.value: This dataset contains information about the entities who receive the service and associated cost allocations included within each FCC Form 471, and related information from the E-Rate Productivity Center (EPC). Use this dataset to answer questions such as: Which entities use E-rate funds for their connectivity services? What are the associated cost allocations included within each FCC Form 471? All information within the Recipients of Service (FCC Form 471) dataset is self-reported by applicants.

USAC is committed to sharing the highest quality data possible. We conduct a full analysis of all datasets to determine if they are complete prior to publishing. In most cases, missing values are the result of “not required” fields.

domain_metadata.value: This collection contains connectivity data about the Funding Request Number (FRN) listed within each FCC Form 471, including service type, contract information, service provider data, and cost for the service, as well as related information from the E-Rate Productivity Center (EPC). Use this dataset to answer questions such as: What are the individual service types? What quantity of service did the applicant request? Which service provider is supplying service and what is the length of the contract? What discount did the applicant receive on services? Did the applicant request funding for fiber? All information within the Connectivity Information (FCC Form 471) dataset is self-reported by applicants.
